reviewText: I've always loved ninjitsu as a martial art and the movies too, this version of the octagon is really good very crisp visuals in hd....much better than standard definition dvd version of the movie.
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: This is one of my favorite Chuck Norris films from the 80s.Overall a great presentation with some nice extras.
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: I always like me some Chuck Norris, but he talks to himself (we hear his thoughts) throughout the film and it becomes aggravating after a while. The fights in the Octagon are good, but whomever came up with the device of us hearing Norris' thoughts shoud be shot. Scorpion Releasing does its regular excellent job of giving us the best possible presentation of the film in its original aspect ratio.
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: This is re-release on the same feature title. I'd like to know it it contains with closed-captioning if not then why re-release them at first place. *Keeping my fingers crossed* for the accessible subtitles.
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: I like all Chuck Norris films from his earlier days.Not an Academy Award Winner but I like the martial arts! Granted, his acting is a bit weak but what the heck, he has gotten better over the years!Recommended for Chuck Norris fans!
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: This is a perfect movie of Chuck Norris of all the one he did over the years and always will be perfect etc.
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: Norris, Karen Carlson and Lee VanCleef are outstanding in this sortof Martial Arts / Revenge modern daytale, which crosses over several genres!Van Cleef fans will especially love it.Some dialog is sort of silly in here asone guy in Martial Arts camp calls anoriental a 'bleedin' NAZI'?! Dumb line...
summary: [Three-and-a-half stars out of four] One of Chuck Nossis best ever!
Title: The Octagon

reviewText: This is my forth copy of this one......I keep giving these away ,and getting another for myself......The younger Norris does a great gob in this film.......The fight scene at the end won some awards I guess........This is a keeper.
Title: The Octagon
